RECORD.TEXT: 745232329 9543139 96458/7hv1 139846 9/14/1993 12:00:00 AM DIS Report Status : Unsigned ADMISSION DATE : 9/14/93 9/15/93 HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : Patient is a 49 year old previously healthy female , who was diagnosed in June , 1992 , with a breast carcinoma , after she presented with some breast discomfort on the left side . She underwent a wide resection of a left breast mass by Dr. Ausguall on 8/17/93 . She now presents for left axillary node dissection , to complete her staging . She has no complaints at the time of presentation . noncontributory , her last menstrual period was regular , and last week . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : :q none . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Noncontributory . ALLERGIES : no known drug allergies . SOCIAL HISTORY : Denies cigarette , or alcohol use , she is married and has one child . FAMILY HISTORY : Is negative , there is no breast carcinoma . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : Patient is a pleasant female , in no apparent distress . Her vital signs are stable , she is afebrile . head , eyes , ears , nose , throat : reveals no adenopathy , extra ocular movements intact , pupils equal , round , reactive to light and accommodation . Throat : benign . Cardiac : regular rate and rhythm , normal first and second heart sounds , no murmur , rub or gallop . Abdomen : soft , nontender , nondistended , positive bowel sounds , there is no hepatosplenomegaly . Chest : reveals a well healed incision in the left side , there are no axillary lymph nodes palpable on both sides . Extremities : reveal no clubbing , cyanosis or edema . Motor : 5/5 throughout . Sensory : intact . LABORATORY DATA : sodium 140 , potassium 4.4 , BUN and creatinine 14/.9 , glucose 95 , prothrombin time 10.0 , with a control of 10.2 , partial thromboplastin time 26.9 , urinalysis negative , white blood count 5.8 , hematocrit 37.5 , hemoglobin 13.4 , platelet count 274,000 . The electrocardiogram reveals normal sinus rhythm at 66 beats per minute , with no ST changes , there is R wave progression . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted on 9/14/93 , and underwent on that same day , a left axillary lymph nodes dissection , by Dr. Ausguall . The patient tolerated the procedure well , there were no complications . Postoperative course was unremarkable . At that time her JP was still in place . DISPOSITION : Patient will follow up with Dr. Ausguall , in about 4-5 days , at which time the JP drain will be removed . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Percocet 1-2 tablets PO q3-4 prn .
